simulation.gui
Class MainWindow

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      simulation.gui.MainWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class MainWindow
extends javax.swing.JFrame

This is the main window of the simulation; it contains the main display, and while not necessarily encompassing everything -- there can be some independent frames -- it is the window that is opened first. It is also the class the constructs the model; all the other classes refer to and use this model and do not construct it themselves.

Author:
Tikhon Jelvis
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

VERSION

public static final java.lang.String VERSION
The string that corresponds to the version of the program. This version is incorporated into the title of the window.

See Also:

Method Detail

getModel

public Simulation getModel()
Returns the simulation that this window shows.

Returns:
this window's simulation.

setAllWalls

public void setAllWalls(boolean allWalls)
Sets all the walls to either exist or not; ignores the walls' current states.

Parameters:
allWalls - - whether the walls should exist or not.

setNorthWall

public void setNorthWall(boolean north)
Sets whether the north wall (ceiling) is enabled. If it already is, this method does nothing. To reset the north wall, one must first set it to false.

Parameters:
north - - whether the north wall should be enabled.

setSouthWall

public void setSouthWall(boolean south)
Sets whether the south wall (floor) is enabled. If it already is, this method does nothing. To reset the south wall, one must first set it to false.

Parameters:
south - - whether the south wall should be enabled.

setWestWall

public void setWestWall(boolean west)
Sets whether the west wall (right) is enabled. If it already is, this method does nothing. To reset the west wall, one must first set it to false.

Parameters:
west - - whether the west wall should be enabled.

setEastWall

public void setEastWall(boolean east)
Sets whether the east wall (right) is enabled. If it already is, this method does nothing. To reset the east wall, one must first set it to false.

Parameters:
east - - whether the east wall should be enabled.

resetWalls

public void resetWalls()
Resets the walls -- if not all the walls exist, it creates all the walls and if all of the walls do exist, it gets rid of all the walls.

allWallsExist

public boolean allWallsExist()
Returns whether all the walls exist, or more formally (northWall != null && southWall != null && eastWall != null && westWall != null) .

Returns:
whether all the walls exist.

setWallColor

public void setWallColor(java.awt.Color wallColor)
Sets a new Color for the walls. The walls immediately turn this color, and any new walls are going to be created in this color.

Parameters:
wallColor - - the walls' new color.

getWallColor

public java.awt.Color getWallColor()
Returns the walls' Color.

Returns:
the walls' color.
